title: Rotational equilibrium - sign hanging from beam

content.description: A horizontal beam of mass <math alttext="lowercase m" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math> and length <math alttext="L" overflow="scroll"> <mi>L</mi> </math> is attached at one end to a wall and at the other end by a cable extending to the wall. The angle formed by the cable and the horizontal is <math alttext="theta" overflow="scroll"><mi>θ</mi></math>. A sign of mass <math alttext="uppercase M" overflow="scroll"><mi>M</mi></math> hangs from the end of the beam furthest from the wall, as shown in the figure.
content.question: Which of the following expressions correctly represents the tension in the cable?
